Eamon Gilmore said Labour's no-confidence vote in parliament would allow lawmakers of all parties the chance to force an immediate election and end Brian Cowen 's delaying tactics. It is now make-your-mind-up time for the Green Party, for the independents and for Fianna Fail backbenchers who have been critical of government: Are you prepared to give the people the election they want, or are you going to prolong the life of this dysfunctional, demoralized and discredited government? Eamon Gilmore said. Brian Cowen 's government has an 82-81 edge in parliament. The pro-Brian Cowen total includes six Greens and three independents. Eamon Gilmore said he expected the government to free parliament time for a vote
